intro: Xyris linifolia, commonly known as slender threadleaf goldeneye, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Xyridaceae family, which includes various grass-like plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist habitats. Xyris linifolia is often found in sandy or acidic soils and is adapted to periodic flooding.
